House of Oldenburg****House of Brandenburg

House of Stuart aka Stewart

​

***

​

John I, 'Count of Oldenburg' - b. c. 1204, d. c. 1270. M. Richeza 'Rixa' of Hoya-Stumpenhausen. Ch. Heilwig, Christian III, Maurice, Otto II

​

Heilwig [Hoya-Stumpenhausen]

​

Christian III, 'Count of Oldenburg' [First attested, 1269 - 1285) [Hoya-Stumpenhausen] - b. (?), d. 1285, Oldenburg. M. Jutta of Bentheim. Ch. 3-s, one being John II

​

John II, of Oldenburg (Reign: 1272 - c. 1301) [Jutta] - b. before 1272, d. c. 1314/16. M. 1st, Elisabeth of Brunswick-Luenburg d/o John , 'Duke of Brunswick and Lunenburg' and Liutgard von Holstein-Itzehoe; M. 2nd, Hedwig, 'Countess of Kiephotz. Ch. Christian IV, John III, Conrad I, Maurice, Gisela

Christian IV, 'Count of Oldenburg' [Hedwig, of Diephotz]

John III, 'Count of Oldenburg' [Hedwig, of Diephotz] - b. (?), d. (?). M. Mechtild 'Matilda', of Bronckhorst

Conrad I, 'Count of Oldenburg' (Reign: 1344 - 1347) [Hedwig, of Diephotz] - b. (?), Oldenburg, Oldenburg, Germany, d. 1367, Germany. M. Ingeborg, of Holstein-Plon. Ch. Conrad II, Gerard, Agnes, Christian V

Conrad II [Ingeborg]

Gerard [Ingeborg]

Agnes [Ingeborg]

Christian V, 'Count of Oldenburg' (Reign: 1368 - 1398) [Ingeborg] - b. c. 1342, d. after 6 April 1399. M. Agnes of Holstein. Ch. Dietrich

​

Dietrich, 'Theoderic', 'Count of Oldenburg' (1403) [Agnes] - b. 1398, d. 14 February 1440, Delmenhorst, Germany. Buried: Roskilde Cathedral, Roskilde, Denmark. M. 1st, Countesss Adelheid, of Oldenburg-Delmenhorst - b. (?), d. c. 1404; M. 2nd, 1423, Helvig, of Schauenburg - b. btwn 1398 - 14000, d. 1436 w/o Prince Balthasar, of Mecklenburg d/o Duke Gerhard VI, of Schleswig and Holstein and Elisabeth of Brunswick. Ch. Christian I, Maurice V, Gerhard VI, Adelheid

​

Christian I, of Oldenburg, 'Christian I', 'King of Denmark' (Reign: 1 September 1448 - 21 May 1481), 'King of Norway' (Reign: 13 May 1450 - 21 May 1481), 'King of Sweden' (Reign: 23 June 1457 - 23 June 1464) [Helvig] - b. February 1426, Oldenburg, d. 21 May 1481, Copenhagen Castle. Buried: Roskilde Cathedral. M. 1449, Dorothea, of Brandenburg, 'Queen Dorothea' - b. c. 1430/31, Brandenburg, d. 10 November 1495, Kalundborg, Denmark. Buried: Roskilde Cathedral d/o John Margrave, of Brandenburg, Kulmbach and Barbara of Saxe-Wittenberg [M. 1st, 12 September 1445, Copenhagen, Christopher III, King of Denmark; Granted dowers of three Kingdoms: Roskilde, Ringsted, Haraldsborg, Skioldenses, Denmark, Jamtland, Norway Orebro, Narke and Varmland Sweden. Ch. No] [At her marriage of Christian I she renounced her dower lands in Denmark and Norway, which were replaced with Kalundborg and Samso, in Denmark and Romerike in Norway, but refused to renounce her Swedish dower lands]. Ch. Olaf, Canute, John, 'King of Denmark', Margaret, 'Queen of Scots', Frederick I, 'King of Denmark'

​

Olaf - b. 1450, d. 1451 (age 1 yrs)

Canute - b. 1451, d. 1455 (age 4 yrs)

John Hans, 'né Johannes', John II, 'King of Denmark' (Reign: 21 May 1481 - 20 February 1513), 'King of Norway', (Reign: 1483 - 20 February 1513), 'King of Sweden (Reign: 6 October 1497 - August 1501)', 'Monarch of the Kalmar Union', 'Duke of Schleswig and Holstein' (joint rule with brother Frederick I, of Denmark) - b. 2 February 1455, Aalborghus Castle, Aalborg, d. 20 February 1513, Aalborghus Castle, Aalborg. Buried: St. Canute's Cathedral, Odense. M. Christina of Saxony - b. 25 December 1461, Torgau, Germany, d. 8 December 1521, Odense, Denmark. Buried: St. Canute's Cathedral, Odense, Denmark d/o Ernst, Elector of Saxony and Elisabeth of Bavaria-Munich, Electress of Saxony. Ch. Hans, Ernst, Christian II, Jacob, Elisabeth, Francis, Knud; Mistress: Edele Jernskjaeg

​

Hans - b. 1479, d. 1480 (age 1 yrs)

​

Ernst - b. 1480, d. 1500 (age 20 yrs)

​

Christian II, 'the Tyrant' 'King of Denmark', 'King of Norway' (Reign: 22 July 1513 - 20 January 1523), 'King of Sweden' (Reign: 1 November 1520 - 23 August 1521) - b. 1 July 1481, Nyborg Castled. 25 January 1559. Kalundborg Castle, as a prisoner. Buried: St. Canute's Cathedral. M. Isabella, of Austria Ch. John, Philip Ferdinand, Maximilian, Dorothea, Christina

​

John [Heir to the thrones of Denmark, Norway, Sweden] - b. 21 February 1518, d. 2 August 1532. (age 14 yrs)

​

Philip Ferdinand (twin of Maximilian) - b. 4 July 1519, d. 1520 (age 1 yrs)

​

Maximilian (twin of Philip Ferdinand) - b. 4 July 1519, d. 1519, young

​

Dorothea 'Electress Palatine' - b. 10 November 1520, Copenhagen, d. 31 May 1580, Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz. Buried: Church of the Holy Ghost, Heidelberg. M. 1535, Frederick II, 'Count Palainte of the Rhine, 'Elector Palatine', 'Frederick the Wise' - b. 9 December 1482, d. 26 February 1556 s/o Philip, Elector Palatine and Margarete of Bavaria-Landshut. Ch. No

Princess Christina, of Denmark, 'Duchess of Milan' - b. c. 1522, d. c. 1590. M. 1st, 1533, Francis II Sforza. Ch. No; M. 2nd, 10 July 1541, Brussels, Francis I, 'Duke of Lorraine' - b. 23 August 147, Nancy, France, d. 12 June 1545, Remiremont, France s/o Antoine, 'Duke of Lorraine' and Renée de Bourbon-Montpensier. Ch. Charles III, Renata, Dorothea

​

Charles III, Duke of Lorraine - b. 18 February 1543, Ducal Palace of Nancy, d. 14 May 1608. M. Claude, of Valois. Ch. Henry II, Christina, Grand Duchess of Julich-Cleves-Berg, Francis II, 'Duke of Lorraine', Catherine, Abbess of Remiremont, Elisabeth, Electress of Bavaria

​

Henry II, Duke of Lorraine [Claude] - b. 1563, d. 1624. M. 1st, 31 January 1599, Chateau de Saint Germain-en-Laye, Paris, Catherine de Bourbon. Ch. No; M. 2nd, 24 April 1606, Mantua, Margerita Gonzaga d/o Vincenzo Gonzaga, 'Duke of Mantua' and Eleonora de'Medici. Ch. Stillborn daughter, Nicole of Lorraine, Daughter, Claude Francoise de Lorraine

​

Stillborn daughter [de Bourbon]

​

Nicolette de Lorraine, 'Duchess of Lorraine' [de Bourbon] - b. 3 October 1608, Nancy, Lorraine, d. 23 February 1657, Paris, France. M. 23 May 1621, Charles IV, 'Duke of Lorraine' s/o Francis, Count of Vaudémont Separated: 1635. [M. 2nd, 2 Paris 1637, Béatrice de Cusance. Princess de Cantecroix d/o and heiress of Claude-Francois de Cusance Baron de Belvoir and Ernestine de Witthem, Countess van Walhain w/o Eugene Perrenot de Granvelle dit d'Oiselet, Prince de Cantecroix. Ch. Francis de Lorraine, Anne de Lorraine, Charles Henri de Lorraine (the marriage was not considered valid by the Catholic church, they separated in April 1642 and he was excommunicated); M. 3rd, 20 May 1663, (to legitimize their children) Beatrice de Cusance, Beatrice died two weeks later; M. 4th, Marie Louise d'Aspremont Ch. No]

​

Daughter de Lorraine [de Bourbon] - b. 10 February 1611, d. 11 February 1611 (age 1 day)

​

Claude Francoise de Lorraine [de Bourbon] - b. 6 October 1612, Ducal Palace, of Nancy, Lorraine, d. 2 August 1648. Vienna, Austria. Buried: Church of Saint-Francois-des-Cordelieres,Nancy. M. 18 February 1634, Lunéville, Nicholas II, 'Duke of Lorraine' - b. 6 December 1609, d. 25 January 1670. Ch. Ferdinand Philippe, Charles Leopold, Anne Eleanore de Lorraine, Anne Marie Therese de Lorraine

​

Ferdinand Philippe, 'Hereditary prince of Lorraine', suo jure, 'Duke of Bar' [de Lorraine] - b. 29 December 1639, d. 1 April 1659 (age 19 yrs)

Charles V, Charles Leopold Nicolas Sixte, 'Duke of Lorraine and Bar' [de Lorraine] - b. 3 April 1643, Vienna, Archduchy of Austria, Holy Roman Empire, d. 18 April 1690, Wels, Austria. Buried: Braunschweig, Lower Saxony. M. 1678, Eleonora Maria Josefa, of Austria, 'Queen of Poland', 'Duchess of Lorraine' - b. 21 May 1653, d. 17 December 1697, 'Duchess of Lorraine' d/o Ferdinand III, Holy Roman Emperor and Eleanor Gonzaga [M. 1st, 1670, King Michael Korybut Wisniowiecki] Ch. Leopold, 'Duke of Lorraine', Charles Joseph, Eleanor, Charles Ferdinand, Joseph Innocent Emanuel, Francois Antoine Joseph

​

Leopold, 'the Good', 'Duke of Lorraine and Bar' (1690 - 1729) [Direct male ancestor of all rulers of the Habsburg-Lorraine dynasty, including all emperors of Austria] [Eleonora] - b. 11 September 1679, Palace of Innsbruck Tyrol, Austria, d. 27 March 1729, Chateau de Luneville Lorraine, France. Buried: Eglise Saint-Francois-des-Cordeliers, Nancy France. M. Elisabeth Charlotte d'Orleans 'Duchess consort of Lorraine' (Tenure: 13 October 1698 - 27 March 1729),'Princess of Commercy', (Reign: 9 July 1737 - 23 December 1744) - b. 13 September 1676, Chateau de Saint-Cloud, France, d. 23 December 1744, Chateau de Commercy, Lorraine. Buried: Eglise Saint -Francois-des-Cordeliers, Nancy, France 'Ch. Leopold, Elisabeth Charlotte, Louise Christine, Marie Gabriele Charlotte, Louis, Josepha Gabriele, Gabriele Louise Theresa, Queen of Sardinia, Charles Alexander of Lorraine, Anne Charlotte, Leopold Clement, Francis I, Holy Roman Emperor,

​

Leopold, 'Hereditary Prince of Lorraine' [d'Orléans] - b. 26 August 1699, d. 2 April 1700 (age 1 yrs)

​

Louise Christine [d'Orléans] - b. 13 November 1701, d. 18 November 1701 (age 5 days)

​

Francis Stephen, Francis I, 'Holy Roman Emperor', 'King in Germany' (Reign: 13 September 1745 - 18 August 1765), 'Archduke' (Reign: 21 November 1740 - 18 August 1765), 'Grand Duke of Tuscany' (Reign: 12 July 1737 - 18 August 1765, 'Duke of Lorraine' (Reign: 27 March 1729 - 9 July 1737) [d'Orléans] - b. 8 December 1708, Ducal Palace of Nancy, Lorraine, Holy Roman Empire, d. 18 August 1765, Palace of Innsbruck, Austria. Buried: Imperial Crypt. M. 1736, Maria Theresa Walburga Amalia Christina, of Austria 'Holy Roman Empress, German Queen' (Reign: 13 September 1745 - 18 August 1765), 'Queen of Bohemia' (Reign: 12 May 1743 - 29 November 1780), 'Archduchess of Austria', 'Queen of Hungary and Croatia' (Reign: 20 October 1740 - 29 November 1780) - b. 13 May 1717, Vienna, Austria, d. 29 November 1780, Vienna, Austria. Buried: Imperial Crypt. Ch. Archduchess Maria Elisabeth, Archduchess Maria Anna, Archduchess Maria Carolina, Joseph II, Holy Roman Emperor, Maria Christina, Duchess of Teschen, Archduchess Maria Elisabeth, Archduek Charles Joseph, Maria Amalia, Duchess of Parma, Leopold II, Holy Roman Emperor, Archduchess Maria Carolina, Archduchess Johanna Gabriela, Archduchess Maria Josepha, Maria Carolina, Queen of Naples and Sicily Ferdinand, Duke of Breisgau, Maria Antonia, Queen of Francie, Maximilian Francis,

Archbishop-Elector of Cologne

​

Archduchess Maria Elisabeth [Maria Theresa] - b. 5 February 1737, Vienna, Austria, d. 7 June 1740, Laxenburg. Buried: Imperial Crypt (age 3 yrs)

Archduchess Maria Anna, 'Abbess of the Frauenstift' [Heir presumptive] [Maria Theresa] - b. 6 October 1738, Hofburg Palace, Vienna, Austria, Holy Roman Empire, d. 19 November 1789, Klagenfurt, Austria. M. No. Ch. No

Joseph II, 'Holy Roman Emperor', 'Duke of Lorraine and Bar', 'King of Jerusalem', 'Duke of Calabria' [Maria Theresa] - b. 13 March 1741, Schonbrunn Palace, Vienna, Archduchy of Austria, d. 20 February 1790, Vienna, Archduchy of Austria. Buried: Imperial Crypt. M. October 1760, Princess Isabella Maria Luisa Antonietta Ferdinanda Giuseppina Saveria Domenica Giovanna, of Parma - b. 31 December 1741, Buen Retiro Palace, Madrid, Spain, d. 27 November 1763, Schonbrunn Palace, Vienna, Austria. Buried: Imperial Crypt, Vienna Ch. Archduchess Maria Theresa, Child, Child, Archduchess Maria Christina; M. 2nd, 1765, Maria Josepha of Bavaria, 'Holy Roman Empress' (Tenure: 18 August 1765 - 28 May 1767), 'Queen of the Romans' (Tenure: 23 January 1765 - 28 May 1767) - b. 20 March 1739, Munich, Bavaria, d. 28 May 1767, Schonbrunn Palace, Vienna, Austria, smallpox. Buried: Imperial Crypt, Vienna. Ch. No

​

Archduchess Maria Theresia Elisabeth Philippine Luise Josepha Johanna [Isabella] - b. 20 March 1762, d. 23 January 1770, pleurisy (age 7 yrs)

Child [Isabella] - b/d. August 1762, miscarriage

Child [Isabella] - b/d. January 1763, miscarriage

Archduchess Maria Christina [Isabella] - b. 22 November 1763, d. 22 November, 3 mos premature

Maria Christina, 'Duchess of Teschen' (dower), [Resided at Palace of Laeken] [Maria Theresa] - b. 13 May 1742, Vienna, Austria, D. 24 June 1798, Vienna, Austria. Buried: Imperial Crypt. M. Prince Albert Casimir, of Saxony, 'Duke of Teschen', Governor of Hungary (1765 - 1781), seated at Bratislava Castle, summer residence in Halbturn Castle, Neusiedl am See District; Governor of the Austrian Netherlands (Tenure: 1781 - 1793) - b. 11 July 1738, Moritzburg, 'Electorate of Saxony', d. 10 February 1822, Vienna, Austria. Buried: Ducal Crypt, Vienna. Ch. Princess Maria Christina Theresa of Saxony

​

Princess Maria Christina Theresa of Saxony [Maria Christina] - b/d. infant

​

Archduke Charles of Austria, 'Duke of Teschen' (Habsburg-Lorraine) [Received Art Collection of his adopted father, Albert Casimir] [Natural born son of Leopold, Grand 'Duke of Tuscany', adopted by Maria and Albert] [Maria Christina] - b. 5 September 1771, d. 30 April 1847

Archduchess Maria Elisabeth Josepha Johanna Antonia [Maria Theresa] - b. 13 August 1743, Schonbrunn Palace, Vienna, Archduchy of Austria, Holy Roman, Empire, d. 22 September 1808, Linzer Palace, Linz, Empire of Austria. Buried: Jesuit Church of Linz. M. No. Ch. No

Archduke Charles Joseph, of Austria [Maria Theresa] - b. 1 February 1745, Schonbrunn Palace, Vienna, D. 18 January 1761, Schonbrunn Palace, Vienna. Buried: Imperial Crypt, Capuchin Church, Innere Stadt, Vienna (ag 15 yrs)

Maria Amalia, 'Duchess of Parma, Piacenza and Guastalla' (Tenure: 19 July 1769 - 9 October 1802) [Maria Theresa] - b. 26 February 1746, Hofburg Imperial Palace, Vienna, D. 18 June 1804, Prague Castle, Prague. Buried: St. Vitus Cathedral, Prague. M. 19 July 1769, Ducal Palace of Colorno, Ferdinand, 'Duke of Parma, Piaenza and Guastalla' (Reign: 18 July 1765 - 9 October 1802) - b. 20 January 1751, Parma, d. 9 October 1802, Fontevivo. Ch. Carolina, Louis, Princess Maria Antonia

​

Princess Maria Carolina Teresa Giuseppa, of Parma, 'Hereditary Princess of Saxony' [Maria Amalia] - b. 22 November 1770, Ducal Palace of Colorno, Parma, d. 1 March 1804, Dresden Castle, Dresden. ​

M. 6 May 1821, Florence, Ferdinand III, 'Grand Duke of Tuscany' (Reign: 22 July 1790 - 3 August 1801), 'Elector of Salzburg' (Reign: 11 February 1803 - 25 December 1805), 'Elector of Wurzburg' (Reign: 25 Dcmber 1805 - 6 August 1806), 'Grand Duke of Wurzburg' (Reign: 25 December 1805 - 1 May 1814) - b. 6 May 1769, Florence, d. 18 June 1824,Florence [M. 1st, 1790, Princess Luisa, of Naples and Sicily. Frederick Augustus II, 'King of Saxony' (Reign: 6 June 1836 - 9 August 1854) [Maria Carolina] - b. 18 May 1797, Pillnitz, Dresden, d. 9 August 1854, Karrosten. Buried: Katholische Hofkirche. M. 1st, proxy, 26 September 1819, Vienna, person, 7 October 1819, Dresden, Archduchess Marie Caroline Ferdinande Theresia Josephine Demetria, of Austria; d/o Francis I, of Austria. Ch. No M. 2nd, 24 April 1833, Dresden, Princess Maria Anna Leopoldine Elisabeth Wilhelmine, of Bavaria d/o King Maximilian I, Joseph of Bavaria. Ch. No; Paramour Mistress: Unknown. Ch. Theodor Uhlig

Archduchess Auguste Ferdinande, of Austria [Maria Anna] - b. 1 April 1825, Florence, Italy, d. 26 April 1864, Munich, Germany. Buried: Theatinerkirche. M. 15 April 1844, Florence, Prince Luitpold, of Bavaria, 'Prine Regent of Bavaria (10 June 1886 - 12 December 1912). Ch. Ludwig III, Prince Leopold, Princess Therese, Prince Arnulf

Ludwig III, 'King of Bavaria' (Reign: 5 November 1913 - 13 November 1918) [Auguste] - b. 7 January 1845, Munich, Bavaria, d. 18 October 1921, Sarvar, Hungary. Buried: Munich Frauenkirche. M. Prince John, of Saxony 'King of Saxony' (Reign: 9 August 1854 - 29 October 1873) - b. 12 December 1801, Dresden, Electorate of Saxony, d. 29 October 1873, Pillnitz, Dresden. Buried: Katholische Hofkirche, Dresden d/o Maximilian I Joseph, of Bavaria and Caroline of Baden. Ch. Albert, Maria Elisabeth, George, Anna, Margaretha, Sophie

Maria Augusta Fredericka Karoline Ludovike Amalie Maximiliane Franziska Nepomucena Xaveria, 'Princess Maria' - b. 22 January 1827, Dresden, d. 8 October 1857, Dresden, tuberculosis

Frederick Augustus Albert Anton Ferdinand Joseph Karl Maria Baptist Nepomuk Wilhelm Xaver Georg Fidelis, 'King of Saxony' - b. 23 April 1828, Dresden, d. 19 June 1902, Schloss Sibyllenort. M. 18 June 1853, Dresden, Princess Carola, of Vasa - b. 5 August 1833, Schonbrunn, d. 15 December 1907, Dresden, titular Princess of Sweden, 'Queen consort of Saxony' (Tenure: 29 October 1873 - 19 June 1902). Buried: Katholische Hofkirche d/o Crown Prince Gustav of Sweden. Ch. No, (10 miscarriages)

Maria Elisabeth Maximiliana Ludovika Amalie Franziska Sophia Leopoldine Anna Baptista Xaveria Nepomucena, 'Elisabeth' - b. 4 February 1830, Dresden, d. 14 August 1912, Stresa.
